de.javakaffee.web.msm
Class NodeAvailabilityCache<K>

java.lang.Object
  de.javakaffee.web.msm.NodeAvailabilityCache<K>
Type Parameters:
K - the type of the key
public class NodeAvailabilityCache<K>
extends java.lang.Object

An LRUCache that supports a maximum number of cache entries and a time to live for them. The TTL is measured from insertion time to access time.

Constructor Summary
NodeAvailabilityCache(int size, long ttlInMillis, de.javakaffee.web.msm.NodeAvailabilityCache.CacheLoader<K> cacheLoader)
          Create a new LRUCache with a maximum number of cache entries and a specified time to live for cache entries.

Constructor Detail

NodeAvailabilityCache

public NodeAvailabilityCache(int size,
                             long ttlInMillis,
                             de.javakaffee.web.msm.NodeAvailabilityCache.CacheLoader<K> cacheLoader)
Create a new LRUCache with a maximum number of cache entries and a specified time to live for cache entries. The TTL is measured from insertion time to access time.

Parameters:
size - the maximum number of cached items
ttlInMillis - the time to live in milli seconds. Specify -1 for no limit
cacheLoader - the cache loader to use
Method Detail

setNodeAvailable

public java.lang.Boolean setNodeAvailable(K key,
                                          boolean available)
If the specified key is not already associated with a value or if it's associated with a different value, associate it with the given value. This is equivalent to 
  if (map.get(key) == null || !map.get(key).equals(value))
    return map.put(key, value);
 else
    return map.get(key);
except that the action is performed atomically.

Parameters:
key - the key to associate the value with.
available - the value to associate with the provided key.
Returns:
the previous value associated with the specified key, or null if there was no mapping for the key

isNodeAvailable

public boolean isNodeAvailable(K key)
Determines, if the node is available. If it's not cached, it's loaded from the cache loader.

Parameters:
key - the key to check
Returns:
true if the node is marked as available.

getKeys

public java.util.List<K> getKeys()
All known keys.

Returns:
a list of all keys, never null.

getUnavailableNodes

public java.util.Set<K> getUnavailableNodes()
A set of nodes that are stored as unavailable.

Returns:
a set of unavailable nodes, never null.
